title: Frankfurt (Main) Hauptbahnhof
summary: Frankfurt (Main) Hauptbahnhof (German for Frankfurt (Main) main station), often abbreviated as Frankfurt (Main) Hbf and sometimes translated as Frankfurt central station,[2] is the busiest railway station in Hesse, Germany.[2] The affix "Main" comes from the city's full name, Frankfurt am Main ("Frankfurt on the Main"). Because of its location near the middle of Germany and usage as a transport hub for long and short distance travelling, Deutsche Bahn refers to it as the most important station in Germany.
